summary: This bill, the Wildfire Victim Tax Relief and Recovery Act, addresses tax implications for victims of the Texas Panhandle fires. It excludes certain payments received by individuals as compensation for losses, damages, and expenses related to the fires from taxable income. The bill also amends sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide relief concerning involuntary conversions of livestock and proceeds from livestock sales due to fire. The provisions primarily focus on financial and tax-related assistance for those affected by the wildfires.
